member.name: T:Xbehave.ContinueOnFailureAfterAttribute
member.summary:
Allows step execution within a scenario to continue after a failed step.
To allow step execution to continue after any failed step: [ContinueOnFailureAfter(StepType.Any)].
To allow step execution to continue after a failed step but only after the execution of the first "Then" step, use [ContinueOnFailureAfter(StepType.Then)].
The default setting is StepType.None. This attribute can be applied at the level of method (scenario), class (feature) or assembly (product).
